channel.title: Can anyone make this into a .Jar file?

item.title: Can anyone make this into a .Jar file?
item.dc:creator: @linker009 linker009
item.description:
@linker009 wrote:

you do realise that a jar file is similar to an archive being that it contains many many files that are accessable while its in that format. you might want a .java file, in which case its very easy, just open up notepad and name it something.java, and paste all of that in it.

item.title: Can anyone make this into a .Jar file?
item.dc:creator: @Ethanmaster2 Ethanmaster2
item.description:
@Ethanmaster2 wrote:

import java.io.*;

public class antilag
{

public int ResetTimer = 0;

public void resetserver()
{
misc.println(“RESETING SERVER!!!”);
misc.println(“Saving all games…”);
PlayerHandler.kickAllPlayers = true;
misc.println(“GAME SUCCESSFULLY SAVED FOR ALL PLAYERS”);
ResetTimer = 0;
closeListener();
runserver();
}
public void process()
{
ResetTimer += 1;
if(ResetTimer >= 9999999)
{
resetserver();
}
}

public void runserver()
{
try
{
String run = “runserver.bat”;
String xstr = “./”+run;
Runtime.getRuntime().exec(xstr);
}
catch (IOException ioe)
{
ioe.printStackTrace();
}
}

public void closeListener()
{
try {
server.shutdownClientHandler = true;
if(server.clientListener != null) server.clientListener.close();
server.clientListener = null;
}
catch(java.lang.Exception __ex)
{
__ex.printStackTrace();
}
}
}

Read full topic
